model

Class BallModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.BallModel

  • public class BallModel
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a ball in the game. A ball consists of a BallPosition, a StartSpeed, dX, dY and an Angle. dX is the horizontal speed, dY the vertical speed, and their value depends on Angle. The sum of dX and dY is equal to Speed.
    Author:
    Daniel and Oscar

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BallModel()
      Standard constructor of a ball.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BallModel

        public BallModel()
        Standard constructor of a ball.

    • Method Detail

      • leftBarBounce

        public void leftBarBounce(double distance)
        Method to run when the ball hits the left Bar. The Angle, dX and dY are changed depending on the value of "distance" to make the ball bounce of the bar and go in another direction.
        Parameters:
        distance - The distance in percent from the Bar's center where the ball bounced.

      • rightBarBounce

        public void rightBarBounce(double distance,
                           java.awt.Dimension fieldSize)
        Method to run when the ball hits the right Bar. The Angle, dX and dY are changed depending on the value of "distance" to make the ball bounce of the bar and go in another direction.
        Parameters:
        distance - The distance in percent from the Bar's center where the ball bounced.
        fieldSize - The size of the game field.

      • getBallPos

        public java.awt.Point getBallPos()
        Getter for the ball's position.
        Returns:
        The ball's position.

      • moveBall

        public void moveBall(long delta_t)
        Moves the ball's position by adding dX to the ball's x position and dY to the ball's y position.
        Parameters:
        delta_t - The time since the previous time the game's compute method was called.

      • setXSpeed

        public void setXSpeed(double speed)
        Setter for the ball's dX(horizontal) speed.
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed to set dX to.

      • getXSpeed

        public double getXSpeed()
        Getter for the ball's dX(horizontal) speed.
        Returns:
        The ball's dX.

      • setYSpeed

        public void setYSpeed(double speed)
        Setter for the ball's dY(vertical) speed.
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed to set dY to.

      • getYSpeed

        public double getYSpeed()
        Getter for the ball's dY(vertical) speed.
        Returns:
        The ball's dY.

      • setYPos

        public void setYPos(int y)
        Setter for the ball's y position.
        Parameters:
        y - The y position to update to.

      • setXPos

        public void setXPos(int x)
        Setter for the ball's x position.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position to update to.

      • resetBall

        public void resetBall(java.awt.Dimension fieldSize)
        Resets the ball to the starting position and speed. The ball will start by moving randomly to the left or to the right.
        Parameters:
        fieldSize - The size of the game field.

      • increaseSpeed

        public void increaseSpeed(double increaseWith)
        Increases the ball's speed by increaseWith.
        Parameters:
        increaseWith - Value to increase the speed with.

      • getSpeed

        public double getSpeed()
        Getter for the ball's speed.
        Returns:
        The ball's speed.
